intro: Toulicia pulvinata, commonly known as the pulvinate toulicia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive pulvinate (swollen) nodes on its stems, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Toulicia pulvinata is often found in moist, tropical environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
